Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Narendra Modi is one of the most corrupt Prime Ministers in the world, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only mentions a research by "BBC News Hub" without providing any specific details or sources to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the website "www.bbcnewshub.com" is related to the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), which is not the case. This assumption is problematic as it misleads readers into believing that the claim has credibility.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Narendra Modi's assets were disclosed by the PMO in September 2017, which showed no evidence of him using his powers to develop his own businesses or making billions during his government.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting grammatical errors and poor drafting, suggesting that it is not the work of a credible source like BBC News.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not explore or provide alternative explanations for the allegations made against Narendra Modi, leaving room for other possibilities or perspectives.
